Follow quality environmental policies and have knowledge of AS9100 and IS14001.

Adherence to Safety
Follow safety procedures, security protocol, and wear proper PPE.

Education and/or Experience
High school diploma or equivalent general education degree (GED). In pursuit of Bachelor’s degree (B. S.) in engineering or computer science from a four-year accredited university.

Reasoning Ability
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. Full Job Description The Arizona Department of Homeland Security - Cyber Command is recruiting for several Cyber Security Interns. This would be a prime opportunity for those interested in pursuing a career in Cybersecurity to gain invaluable hands-on experience in the field within a large public sector environment. The Cyber Security Interns will apply critical thinking skills in a cyber environment and learn how to look for threats and risks and apply mitigation techniques. They will learn how to effectively evaluate supply chain compliance against industry risk management best practices for cyber security. Work within a team to apply a NIST based policy and standards framework across a large group of diverse State Agencies.

Job Duties:
Develop skills and learn procedures to effectively identify, detect, contain, eradicate, recover, and document cyber incidents in an enterprise environment to effectively defend against cyber threats.
Learn about malware and cyber threat hunting, security analytic tool best practices, vulnerability scanning and reporting.
Work on Security Compliance assessments to include reviewing vendor compliance against required minimum security standards.
Learn how policies and standards are implemented within a public sector enterprise.
Will also learn how to perform risk assessments against policies and standards to document risk and threats.
Utilize a vast array of security tools and resources to locate cyber threats.
Work with a team of people with a cyber security focus, provide regular executive level updates, and contribute to team success with ongoing tracking and implementation of projects.
Attend meetings and offer input and suggestions when appropriate.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities (KSAs):
Solid understanding and knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices and procedures within the Information Technology and Computer Science Field.
Ability to communicate well with others, to perform work in a team environment.
Demonstrate a growth mindset and exhibit a collaborative work style.
Detail orientated, critical thinking, fast-paced work experience in a technical setting

Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited 4-year College or University with a focus in Computer Information Science, Computer Information Security or related and must successfully pass a Department of Public Safety fingerprint background check.

Selective Preference(s):
Completion of Introduction to Computer Science or similar, OR Information Security Essentials or similar, OR Introduction to Information Technology or similar, OR Introduction to Computer Network Security or similar. Familiarity with Computer Scripting Languages is a plus.

Contact Us:
If you have any questions please feel free to contact Luis Bustamante at Luis.Bustamante@azdoa.gov for assistance.

Full Job Description Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly.

This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ, San Diego, CA, or Dallas, TX.

Company Overview

Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose!

As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking.

While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy.

TuSimple was founded in 2015 with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first global commercially viable Autonomous Freight Network.

Opportunity Overview

As a Product Management Intern for TuSimple Connect you will work closely with our engineering team and outside development teams to define the features of our cloud application services that support the autonomous driving solution. You will work closely with the truck scheduling and execution team to deliver on time product releases. You will be responsible for developing a product vision and roadmap complete with user stories, acceptance criteria, prioritization in an agile environment.

Role Responsibilities

Partner with business leaders to develop business requirements and be the technical link between operations and development.

position: Salesforce CRM Development Intern: (Location Flexible - North/Central Alabama OR Southern Tennessee)
description:
Full Job Description Overview:
About Hexagon
Hexagon is a global leader in sensor, software and autonomous solutions. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, and quality across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, safety, and mobility applications. Our technologies are shaping urban and production ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous – ensuring a scalable, sustainable future.

Hexagon’s PPM division empowers its clients to transform unstructured information into a smart digital asset to visualize, build, and manage structures and facilities of all complexities, ensuring safe and efficient operation throughout the entire lifecycle.

Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B) has approximately 21,000 employees in 50 countries and net sales of approximately 3.8bn EUR. Learn more at hexagon.com and follow us @HexagonAB.

© 2021 Hexagon AB and/or its subsidiaries and affiliates. All rights reserved.

Responsibilities:
PPM is seeking a qualified intern for the summer of 2021 to help develop the License Tracking and Management back office system. The ideal candidate will work with Salesforce admins and developers on our back office team in one or more of the following areas:

Work with experienced developers to improve, maintain, and upgrade the LTM system in Salesforce
Work with business analysts and Salesforce admins to create customizations and extensions to the Salesforce system
Participate in Agile process such as demos, planning, estimation, refinement, and retrospectives
Ensure code quality with peer review and unit tests

Qualifications:
Enrolled and actively attending an accredited college or university working towards a degree in an IT-related field.
Understanding of object oriented programming concepts and design patterns.
Ability to work in a configuration-first mindset where customization of out-of-the-box features is preferred to new code.
Knowledge of C# or Java-like programming object-oriented programming languages. Web development experience is a plus.
Highly motivated with strong communication skills.
A self-starter who is eager to learn new tools and contribute to business projects.
Able to follow direction, work independently, and work as a collaborative team member.

Full Job Description Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world's most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better.

SUMMARY

ANSYS empowers the world's most innovative companies to design and deliver transformational products by offering the best and broadest engineering simulation software to solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Thus, through our enriching internship program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists.

As a student intern/co-op, you will help develop our industry-leading simulation software while gaining real experience in your field of study. You will work on a variety of impactful projects to help maintain, validate, advance, and accelerate ANSYS products.

In this co-op, you will support our Release Management Unit (RMU).This is a 40-hour per week paid position starting August 2021 and concluding December2021.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Verify and validate Ansys Inc software installer functionality Create user friendly Tools Work in an Agile Scrum Team Interface with API's (REST) andBuild Management Systems Develop new applications of existing models and/or identify software or model limitations. Ansys Inc Download Center Release Management (Akamai, AWS, Docker) Develop prototypes or test new solution strategies or algorithms. Investigate defects in production code. Develop unit and regression tests. Analyze results and communicate findings Assist with R&D Projects and inititives Large scale internal and external distribution practices and security
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Pursuing a Bachelor's degreein Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering,or related technical degree with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to university after the completion of the internship program.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience or coursework in one or more of the following programming/scripting languages (Python, Java, C++) Linux and shell scripting experience Ability to think critically and problem solve Team Player and willingness to work with others
Due to the federally mandated COVID-19 vaccination requirement impacting federal contractors like Ansys, this position requires you to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to your start date. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medicalor religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws including state and local mandatory vaccination orders.

ALIGNING YOUR VALUES TO OUR SOLUTIONS
At Ansys, our diverse, collaborative teams give us the strength and insight to solve the world's most challenging engineering problems. Our ONE Ansys culture has at its core:

Customer Focus
Results and Accountability
Innovation
Transparency and Integrity
Mastery
Inclusiveness
Sense of Urgency
Collaboration and Teamwork

ENGINEERING YOUR CAREER AT ANSYS
At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary leaders across the globe. Collectively we strive to change the world with innovative technology and transformational solutions. With a prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high - met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. At Ansys, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished." And it's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and do impact real people in real ways. All this is forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel. Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology, empowering our customers to turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a member of the NASDAQ-100. We are proud to have been recognized for the following awards: Bay Area Best Places to Work, a Pillar World Awards Gold Winner, Fast Company Best Places to Work for Innovators, a Gold Stevie Award for Great Employers, the FORTUNE Future 50, a DCA Silver Winner, an R&D100 Finalist, a 20% by 2020 Women on Boards winner, a 2020 Pittsburgh Tech 50 - finalist, and America's Most Responsible Companies.

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

We are committed to creating a culture of inclusion and belonging where everyone thrives as ONE Ansys team.

Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

Nearest Major Market: Philadelphia
Nearest Secondary Market: Harrisburg

Full Job Description Â :
At UL, we know why we come to work.:
Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!

What youâll learn & achieve::
This internship program is sponsored by UL's Business Transformation (BT) team. This team works in partnership with the Testing, Inspection and Certification (TIC) Customer Operating Units, Customer Experience, Commercial Excellence and Innovation & Transformation teams to build a unified customer experience and implement the Digital Strategy to lead the industry. This is done by continuously evaluating operations and examining internal and external customer feedback to identify and develop ways to improve and transform our processes, systems and tools aimed at helping employees meet and exceed our customers’ needs

Interns within the Business Transformation team work together to solve real-world challenges, sometimes spurring innovations that change the way we do business. An internship at UL is an opportunity to learn while doing. Collaborating on exciting projects, not only with talented peers, but with top leaders in your field—most of whom began as interns and co-ops themselves. Our interns will work across the TIC organization on projects aimed at achieving optimal results and service excellence, most of which fall in one of the following areas:

Data Analytics/Science and Process Improvement
Financial Modeling
Digital solutions and Data Migration
Program management/Communications/Change management

Undergraduate student who is entering their sophomore or junior year in the Fall of 2022
Educational concentration in Engineering, Business, Economics, Computer Science or related area
GPA of 3.0 or higher
Strong analytical, research and reporting skills
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Ambitious and resourceful self-starter who works well independently and collaboratively
Ability to remain driven and focused in a remote work environment
Interest in working with and learning from leaders at all levels of the company
UL has COVID-19 protocols and policies in place to ensure the safety of our employees, customers and clients. Effective November 1, 2021, the company mandates that employees are vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment (except where prohibited by law), subject to reasonable accommodation as required by law.

What youâll experience working at UL::
Mission: For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 125 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.
People: Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you’ll almost always hear, “the people.” Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We’re able to deliver the best because we employ the best.
Interesting work: Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers’ create. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world.

Learn More::
Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.

Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com

Full Job Description Looking for an internship where you can make a difference?

At Mary Kay, we are committed to enriching the lives of women and their families around the world, and we offer internships with unlimited opportunities to do something beautiful every day. More than 5,000 employees work in locations across the globe. They provide the products, marketing and other support to millions of Independent Beauty Consultants (IBCs) who work as independent contractors, selling our products directly to consumers.

Through Mary Kay’s Internship Program, students have an opportunity to experience working at one of the world’s largest beauty and direct-selling companies. Our internships are hands-on and learning-intensive, with exposure to our culture, products and the IBCs. You’ll work with encouraging and inspiring leaders who want to help you grow. Our internships can be a path to a full-time position.

Program Details:
Target Start Date: January 2022
Part-time and full-time available

INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY

Automation Development Operations:
Number of Openings: 1
What you will work on: You will work closely with the BTS Automation Architect(s) to develop Cloud and Infrastructure automation/orchestration processes to include authoring code, integrating coded processes into CICD pipelines, and on-boarding non-devops-focused technologists into Infrastructure as Code (IAC) paradigms.

Desired Skills:
Knowledge of operating systems (linux, windows), with experience coding/scripting in one of Bash, Python, Powershell, etc.
Basic understanding of files like XML, JSON, YAML, and Jinja2
Understanding of the concepts of version control systems using git or similar tools
Capable of tutoring others to share knowledge
Understanding of Configuration Management Tools like Ansible, Salt, etc.
Experience using Infrastructure Provisioning Tools like Terraform
Knowledge of using RESTful APIs in stand-alone and systems integration scenarios and familiar with general infrastructure protocols (i.e. DNS, DHCP, AD, etc.)
Preferred Degrees: Computer Science

End User Computing:
Number of Openings: 2
What you will work on: The End User Computing team is responsible for a broad set of technologies that enable everyone at Mary Kay to perform their jobs efficiently. This includes PC’s, Mac’s, telephony and mobile devices, video conferencing and conference rooms, email, remote access solutions, printing, and all the platforms and systems that support these services. You will become a part of the teams that design, deliver, and support these technologies. The EUC teams work remotely most days and our interns will have the opportunity to work remotely or at our corporate headquarters. Intern responsibilities will include:
Providing direct user support by processing tickets submitted to the service desk
Administration activities in platforms such as M365, for example maintaining user accounts, groups, etc.
In-person support at our new support center, The Hive (opening 2022)
Packaging software for automated delivery to end user devices (PC’s, Mac’s, mobile devices
Developing scripts and automation flow
Participating on projects to deliver new capabilities, working on clearly documented and assigned task
Analyzing and reporting on data to reveal trends, opportunities for improvement, and to measure against service level agreements
Working with users to understand their needs, how they leverage the tools that we provide and how we can improve
Producing end user documentation such as quick reference guides or help guides
Technologies that are core to what we do and that you will be leveraging include M365, SCCM, Active Directory, Intune, Citrix, Exchange, Teams, Ivanti, RingCentral, Windows 10/11, MacOS, iOS

Desired Skills:
Working directly with customers
User technical support experience, such as working in an Apple Genius Bar or Geek Squad
Direct knowledge or experience with any of our core technologies, identified above
Scripting or coding experience, especially in PowerShell
Experience with enterprise ticketing or service management systems, such as ServiceNow, BMC or Ivanti
Experience with enterprise device management platforms or their concepts
Any experience in an enterprise IT environment; knowledge of the processes, controls, organizational structure and systems common to a large IT organization
Preferred Degrees: Information Technology, Business Management, or anything IT related

Information Security Threat Hunting and Red Team Support:
Number of Openings: 1

What you will work on:
Application security (SAST/DAST/Composition Analysis/Manual testing/Server/Datbase/API/Code review)
Penetration testing
File share review
Legacy protocol research/remediation
Threat hunting
Create, review, and maintain scripts and documentation
Vulnerability management
Purple teaming with SOC
Public exploit review/detonation in controlled environments for mitigation and impact analysis

Desired Skills:
Candidate must be able to perform research independently and not easily give up
Documentation skills
Experience with PowerShell
Experience within a personal lab environment for safely testing tools/exploits
Preferred Degrees: Cyber Security, Information Systems, Computer Science

Security Operations Center Team Support:
Number of Openings: 1

What you will work on:
Work as a Security Analyst monitoring the Mary Kay environment for cyber security events and utilizing a diverse set of tools to respond to and mitigate events as needed
Proactively use tools and security knowledge to search/hunt for suspicious security related events
Act as point of escalation for third party MSSP level 1 SOC

Desired Skills:
Must be able to perform research independently and not easily give up
Documentation skills
Familiarity with security principles and standard attack vectors

Preferred Degrees:
Cyber Security/Information Systems/Computer Science

Global Digital Tools:
Number of Openings: 1
What you will work on: This internship will expose you to a variety of digital tools/apps that Mary Kay has on their website and available on different mobile platforms for their Independent Beauty Consultants and Consumers. These consist of the Interactive Catalog, Skin Analyzer, and MirrorMe, which uses augmented reality to try on makeup. You will test out features of the apps, recommend a roadmap of enhancements and analyze the digital Mary Kay experience and analytics to improve the overall User Experience.

Learning Objectives:
Analytical thinking
Global projects and deployments exposure
Knowledge of mobile technologies IOS/Android
Application interface/integration UX (mobile and web), and digital analytics
Improve on your oral and written communication skills to collaborate successfully with a diverse group of individuals from a global corporation
Leadership and account management skills to develop and refine procedures and workflows to guide vendors and stakeholders through a project cycle
Ability to translate analytics into actionable recommendations and plans
Learn to approach challenges with a solution-focused attitude and critical skills on the digital user experience while also creating a habit of analyzing data to recommend enhancements and dictate strategy

Responsibilities:
Market research and strategy analysis
Assist in deployment and implementation of new tools and enhancements of current tools
Perform the services of a Business Analyst on DBS/eBusiness product teams
Perform triage of incoming bugs for supported applications
Support enhancements projects for global applications
Support project management for upcoming digital tools
Analyze metrics and user experience to provide recommendations
Preferred Degrees: Information Technology, Focus on Digital

Supply Chain Systems Business Analyst:
Number of Openings: 1
What you will work on: Seeking a motivated business analyst intern who is ready to apply knowledge of business practices and processes in a fast-paced, real-world environment. You will need to have broad knowledge of supply chain processes within manufacturing and distribution ERP systems. Through the use of data analytic tools, you will research, analyze and introduce opportunities for improvements and efficiencies.

Desired Skills:
Good communication and documentation skills
Experience working with all levels of staff to define business and technical requirements as well as to perform application support
Knowledge of supply chain business processes and experience with manufacturing and distribution systems
Proficiency in SQL across multiple platforms and environments
Knowledge around best practices for enterprise IT applications, defining and mapping business processes, and understanding integration between various applications
Knowledge within data mining and other analytic tools
Preferred Degrees: 2nd or 3rd year BS in Information Technology

Minimum Qualifications:
Must still be pursuing undergraduate or master’s degree
3.0 cumulative GPA or higher
Sophomores, Juniors, or Seniors preferred

position: Embedded Software Developer - Spring Part Time, Summer Full Time Intern
description:
Full Job Description About our group:
We are a team within Systems Data Storage chartered with delivering applications and services to provide a cohesive management and user experience across Seagate systems product lines and applications. This layer of the software stack is responsible for data management, configuration of the storage, health and performance monitoring, and industry-standard interfaces and proprietary interfaces for continual maintenance and service of the storage system to well-known customers from internet-connected device data to huge databases on private clouds.

About the role - you will:
Contribute to the Web Based Interface that is the top-most layer of the software stack. It is what the end-user interacts with for configuring, managing and monitoring the disk array system.
Analyze user requirements and contribute to conceiving, designing, and developing these software specifications into embedded software for array devices.
Assist in the resolution of software defects, contribute to design and code reviews, and maintain software design documentation.
Learn to develop embedded software within a Linux framework.
Write automated test cases for software quality assurance.
Brainstorm ideas and drive design discussions with the local and global team.

About you:
Passionate about user experience for developing software solutions
Highly motivated developer that is interested in building software from concept to market
Enjoy finding unique solutions to dynamic customer needs and requirements
Creative problem solver
A team-player willing to collaborate and communicate openly with the team

Your experience includes:
Classwork or experience in front end development
Project or industry experience with Javascript, HTML and CSS
Familiar with Vue.js or other frameworks such as Angular or React
Developing in a Linux environment
Working with version control such as Git or Subversion in a team environment
Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related degree.

Location:
Our Longmont product-design campus is nestled against the foothills with exceptional views of the Rocky Mountains. Here at work, you can grab breakfast and lunch in the on-site cafeteria or get an afternoon espresso, prepared by a professional barista. Our 1,500+ employees enjoy an active on-site experience from sporting activities (get in a few laps at lunch on our 1-mile walking path around campus, play Ping-Pong or volleyball, or stop in our 24- hour fitness center for a group or individual workout) to community service and many employee resource groups including Pride!, Women’s Leadership Network and a Young Professionals Network.

Colorado's 2021 Equal Pay for Equal Work Act (SB 19-085) requires we inform you of the estimated base hourly range for this position: $18-24.50. Actual range is based on fair market value of the role in the geography in which you live based on the requirements of the job and your skills. This posted salary range is a good faith and reasonable estimate, and Seagate reserves the right to adjust this range depending on the qualifications of the selected candidate.

Seagate offers comprehensive benefits to its eligible employees; including, but not limited to, medical, dental, vision and life insurance, short and long term disability, annual variable pay bonus, 401(k), employee stock purchase plan, flexible and dependent care spending accounts, health care spending account, flexible time off/vacation, paid holidays and paid parental leave.

#Internship

Interns typically work Monday through Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.

Location: Longmont, United States
Travel: None

Full Job Description Information Technology Internship - (21002537)
Description

Howmet Aerospace, headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, is a leading global provider of advanced engineered solutions for the aerospace and transportation industries. The Company’s primary businesses focus on jet engine components, aerospace fastening systems and titanium structural parts necessary for mission-critical performance and efficiency in aerospace and defense applications, as well as forged wheels for commercial transportation. At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

At the heart of Defining Possible is our commitment to missions. In rapidly changing global security environments, Northrop Grumman brings informed insights and software-secure technology to enable strategic planning. We’re looking for innovators who can help us keep building on our wide portfolio of secure, affordable, integrated, and multi-domain systems and technologies that fuel those missions. By joining in our shared mission, we’ll support yours of expanding your personal network and developing skills, whether you are new to the field or an industry thought-leader. At Northrop Grumman, you’ll have the resources, support, and team to do some of the best work of your career.Northrop Grumman is seeking a Software Engineering Intern. This position will be located at our Mission Systems Sector in Salt Lake City, UT. The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman's software engineering team creating and maintaining unique software applications that interface with cutting edge inertial navigation and measurement systems used in military and civilian applications from undersea to outer space.Essential Functions: The There will be opportunities for designing and supporting exciting new software solutions to help modernize our product line. The primary software products are object-oriented C# designs developed using Microsoft Visual Studio, while supporting older programs in C++. Other software products provide a wide variety of opportunities with technologies including Perl, PL/SQL, Java, shell scripting, Javascript, CSS, Python, Matlab/Simulink, Excel VBA and more. Software development tasks may include everything from GUI design to low-level engineering code.
Design and develop new software using object-oriented analysis and design.
Maintain and update existing software applications.
Collaborate with system, hardware and manufacturing engineers to provide robust and user friendly applications for end-users.
Basic Qualifications for a Manufacturing Engineer Intern: A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:
Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2022.
Be majoring in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) degree
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2022 and part-time (20 hours per week) during the fall/spring semesters.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.25/4.0 or higher
Previous internship/co-op or other work experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular)
Intern Pay Range: Bachelor’s: $20.75 to $25.75 per hourMaster’s: $30.50 to $32.25 per hourAt Northrop Grumman, our internship pay rates are standardized and take into account three main factors: the anticipated graduation date of the individual, the cost of labor of the geographic location, and whether the internship is considered technical or administrative.

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

description:
Full Job Description This program is a 10-week full-time opportunity that starts on June 6th, 2022 and will end on August 12, 2022.

At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive, and patient focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

You will gain valuable work experience and participate in:
Projects that contribute to the success of our business Community service activities Professional development workshops Mentorship and networking opportunities Interaction with senior leaders
And our corporate interns have an increased likelihood to receive an offer for a future role with CVS Health.

About this business area:
In the Office of the CTO, we design world-class, innovative, integrated, scalable and balanced system solutions aligned with Business and IT strategies.
With critical thinking, deep business knowledge, situational awareness and multi-disciplinary experience, we deliver the transformational insight, trusted advice and technical leadership needed to make optimal use of technology and information assets.

What you will do: In this role, you will partner with other architects to:
Help deliver architectural solutions Record, document and maintain O-CTO documents and processes Study & document/participate with senior architects in developing frameworks, standards and reference material for architecture and associated products. Manage the architecture governance activities associated with ensuring solution compliance. Perform research and development activities for the Office of the CTO. Provide project workstream level architectures for applications, integrations and technology Contribute to the development and maintenance of common services, repositories, and utility components for the enterprise.
Required Qualifications
See Educational Requirements Below

COVID Requirements
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated.

If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health.
If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated.

Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated leadership experience. Examples include: active roles in student or social organization activities, sports, or school or work-related projects Strong written and verbal communication skills Internship or work experience in related field such as business or healthcare Have an interest in obtaining full-time position within CVS Health upon graduation
Education
Be currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree Have an anticipated graduation date between September 2022 and August 2023 Have a major(s)/concentration in Information Technology, Computer Science or related major

At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. Full Job Description Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly.

This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ, San Diego, CA, or Dallas, TX.

Company Overview

Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose!

As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking.

While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy.

TuSimple was founded in 2015 with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first global commercially viable Autonomous Freight Network.

Opportunity Overview

As a Product Management Intern for TuSimple Connect you will work closely with our engineering team and outside development teams to define the features of our cloud application services that support the autonomous driving solution. You will work closely with the truck scheduling and execution team to deliver on time product releases. You will be responsible for developing a product vision and roadmap complete with user stories, acceptance criteria, prioritization in an agile environment.

Role Responsibilities

Partner with business leaders to develop business requirements and be the technical link between operations and development.
Develop detailed requirements, user stories, and wire-frames so the development team knows what to build for our routing engine, network simulation tools, asset management tools, or for vehicle and operations applications.
Provide user interface design ideas when scoping and making decisions regarding user-facing features. Work closely with the UI/UX design team.
Manage the existing product backlog and help prioritize what will be delivered in upcoming releases.
Lead sprint planning, backlog grooming, UAT, product demos, and retros. Clear blockers impacting successful engineering team completion of release/sprint goals.
Work with other product managers to provide the best customer experiences for the product suite and ensure alignment in the prioritization of the work.
Conduct research to support the requirements/acceptance criteria. Coordinate internal and external product acceptance.
Conduct the market/policy research, customer survey, competitor analysis to generate product requirements.
Build cost analyses, business cases, and roadmaps to support future product planning initiatives.

Experience & Skills Required

Enrolled in a MBA or MS degree in Computer Science, Saas/Mobile/Software Development or related engineering field
1-2 years of product management experience building and delivering successful products
Experience supply chain and cloud solution experience
Experience working with global teams and diverse internal and external stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail
Strong data driven analytical and research skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience defining and delivering user stories and story cards, per agile development process
Experience with supporting web-based software products
Ability to manage multiple projects, multi-tasking and meet deadlines
Travel may be required

Intern Perks

Work with world class AI Engineers
Shape the landscape of autonomous driving
Work on significantly important and mission critical projects
Extensive individual support through TuSimple's Mentorship Program
Competitive salary
High full-time employment return rates after completion of Internship Program
Gym membership reimbursement
Monthly team building budget
Onsite Perks (These perks will only be applicable if the internship is onsite)

Full kitchens on every floor with unlimited snacks, drinks, special treats, fruits, meals, and more

TuSimple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This company does not discriminate in employment and personnel practices on the basis of race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above-listed items.

For immediate consideration please email your resume to:
product_management_internship__07769cb12us@ivy.greenhouse.io

Led by a group of elite researchers and engineers, we are working tirelessly to bring safe and reliable autonomous trucking to reality. This transformative endeavor can reduce energy consumptions in the trucking industry, make goods and services more affordable and efficient, and eventually, profoundly improve the quality of life of everyone, including you and I.

Role Responsibilities

Support leading product quality activities, data & schedule for assigned projects
Assessing program / project risks and proactively driving mitigation plans
Partnering with Engineering to define product acceptance plans based on Product Requirement Documents (PRD's) and Product Quality Plans (APQP) for flow down to internal build locations and partner organizations
Providing Quality team's risk assessment as the advocate for the customer experience in programs and projects at a across functional team level
Analyzing field feedback reports, data and information on product performance to provide insights and direction to development teams that help key product and process decision making
Helps dept QE to form the independent unbiased communication channel and link from field quality and customer experience to engineering, development and problem resolution owners
Follow ups and helps formulates actions plans to address top risk, issues and problems that are quantifiable and measurable
Supports driving continual product performance improvement through robust issue and problem management
Monitor tracks and helps defining, monitoring, and owning product Quality KPIs and metrics
Supports Change Control Board: Impact analysis and approvals

Experience & Skills Required

B.S. - Computer Science, Engineering or Business
Data Analysis skills
Computer skills

Intern Perks

Work with world class AI Engineers
Shape the landscape of autonomous driving
Work on significantly important and mission critical projects
Extensive individual support through TuSimple's Mentorship Program
Competitive salary
High full-time employment return rates after completion of Internship Program
Gym membership reimbursement
Monthly team building budget
Onsite Perks (These perks will only be applicable if the internship is onsite)

Breakfast, lunch, and dinner served every day
Full kitchens on every floor with unlimited snacks, drinks, special treats, fruits, meals, and more

Full Job Description What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Processor Architecture Research Intern

AMD Research is an entrepreneurial research organization with a strong track record of driving research innovations into AMD products. We are a global leader in the development of the world’s most advanced high-performance computers (HPC), such as Frontier, the world-leading 1.5 exaflop supercomputer. As part of AMD Research, you will have a role on a winning team that works closely with government and commercial customers along with internal product teams and partners to develop the hardware and software technologies of next generation computing platforms, accelerating AMD to have the world’s highest-performing products.

THE ROLE:
AMD Research seeks a Computer Science or Engineering graduate student toExplore and develop cutting-edge ISA designs for industry-leading processors.

AMD Research nurtures and encourages all co-ops to file quality patents and publish at top-tier research venues out of their internship projects. Previous co-op engineers at AMD Research have gone on to publish the results of their work in major academic and industrial conferences, file patent disclosures for innovative ideas as well as contribute to production code and hardware designs.

Full Job Description Anduril is a defense technology company, bringing Silicon Valley talent and funding to the defense sector. Our technology helps our customers solve their toughest challenges by enabling them to make better, more informed decisions in life-and-death situations. We’ve assembled a diverse team of experts in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor fusion, optics, and data analysis that are creating software and hardware solutions to radically evolve the capabilities of the United States and our allies. We are extraordinary problem solvers, teammates, get-stuff-done-ers, and people who care deeply about our work. If you are passionate about solving problems that have real impact, come join Anduril and build the future of defense.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Anduril is developing a fleet of autonomous robotics systems to tackle the most significant security challenges of America and her allies. Our Systems Software Engineers work on the infrastructure that powers our deployed systems. We develop embedded devices, fine-tune operating systems, and analyze the performance of our devices running on land, sea, and air. Our strong focus on customer security is reflected in our software, networking protocols, build systems, and testing procedures. In this role you will work on a wide variety of systems software engineering tasks at Anduril.

You will be responsible for assisting with the full lifecycle of software development projects, from implementation, packaging, automated testing, field testing, deployment support, and ongoing maintenance.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Implement driver software for robotics peripherals and sensors
Bring-up and test of prototype computer hardware
Work with mechanical and electrical engineers to define requirements for new products
Craft reproducible software build systems
Craft and implement networking protocols
Measure and improve system performance
Create hardware diagnostic, testing, and simulation tools
Provide operational support for production deployments
Review and improve product security
Write embedded microcontroller program code and build systems
Create web service software
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, etc., or equivalent experience
Broad interest in a variety of computer technology topics
Strong algorithmic problem solving abilities
Interest in creating reliable, secure, and testable systems software
Experience or interest in any of: Go, C++, Rust, Linux, NixOS
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data.
Anduril is an equal-opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you are someone passionate to work on problems that matter, we’d love to hear from you!

In accordance with requirements on Anduril as a federal contractor under Executive Order 14042, new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccination or exempt status prior to starting employment.

Full Job Description The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?

At Honeywell, we are blending physical products with software solutions to link people and businesses to the information they need to be more efficient, more productive, and more connected. We have a real passion for the place where
physical meets digital. In this emerging Internet of Things era, the world is moving from simple digital transactions to complex digital-to-physical interfaces. It is here where sensor data from connected devices meet our domain expertise and your Data Science skills to enable solutions like:

Technologies for connected buildings improving comfort and energy efficiency The world's most advanced cockpits, jet engines, auxiliary power units,
turbochargers, along with their efficient maintenance
Refining and petrochemicals process technologies and controls Voice-automated systems Personal protective equipment for connected workers
Your time with Honeywell could be spent in any of the following ways:
Extracting, transforming, and loading data in preparation for analysis Engineering features incorporating domain expertise and statistical aggregations Developing and evaluating statistical inference models based on those features, solving a costumer’s problem. Deploying analytic solutions to production platforms, ready to be used in one of Honeywell’s products or services. Some frameworks we use are: Jupyter, RStudio, Flask, OpenCPU. Some of the tools we use include Git, Docker, Bamboo, and more Some of the databases we use are: Hive, SQL, Dremio, and Druid to name a few
Our teams live by the ‘teach and learn’ mantra. We value our more seasoned data scientists because they bring additional value to our company by using their years of experience to guide the next generation. We also value you, our young talent. We'll assign you a mentor on day one, so you can take advantage of this amazing learning opportunity. We want you to finish your internship with a much better understanding of the data science field and Honeywell. We know you'll be a better data scientist by the time this internship ends!

Must Have

Pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree in Engineering or Computer Science related discipline at an accredited college or university Have completed at least your first year of a college or university Be able to participate in an internship prior to completing current degree program
We Value

Minimum 85% course average (3.7 GPA) Be familiar with one or more of the following programming languages: Python, R, MatLab, Java, or C++ Insatiable appetite for learning new technologies Committed pursuit of innovative solutions
Additional Information
JOB ID: req308990
Category: Engineering
Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States
Nonexempt

Full Job Description Who Are We?

We are a secure, cloud-native, machine data analytics service, delivering real-time, continuous intelligence from structured, semistructured and unstructured data across the entire application lifecycle and stack. Our mission is to democratize analytics, making it accessible, simple and powerful for businesses of all sizes to build, run and secure their organizations. With Sumo Logic, customers can harness the power of machine data to gain operational business and customer insights that lead to competitive advantage and differentiated customer experience.

What Do We Do?

Sumo Logic was founded in 2010 by experts in log management, scalable big data systems. We imagined a world of Yottabyte-scale machine data, where machine learning algorithms and advanced analytics could make sense of it all. Today, our purpose-built, cloud-native service analyzes more than 100 petabytes of data, more than 16 million searches, and delivers 10s of millions of insights daily – positioning Sumo among the most powerful machine data analytics services in the world. Our customers around the globe rely on Sumo Logic for the analytics and insights to build, run and secure their modern applications and cloud infrastructures. With Sumo Logic, customers gain a service-model advantage to accelerate their shift to continuous innovation, increasing competitive advantage, business value and growth..

The proliferation of machine log data has the potential to give organizations unprecedented real-time visibility into their infrastructure and operations. With this opportunity comes tremendous technical challenges around ingesting, managing, and understanding high-volume streams of heterogeneous data.

As an Intern on our Backend Engineering team, you'll be responsible for designing and developing a piece of our complex event based processing platform and data infrastructure for our enterprise service. You will be working on a highly distributed, fault tolerant, multi-tenant framework that includes leading edge components related to storage, messaging, search, and analytics.

You should be a quick learner and a strong coder in Java or Scala.

*****Our Ideal Candidate Will be entering their senior year of B.S or M.S!

Responsibilities

Design and develop components of the multi-tenant event-based processing platform
Design and develop data pipeline and systems for management and manipulation of very large data sets
Design and implement extremely high-volume, fault-tolerant, scalable backend systems
Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and reliability of data processing components.

Requirements

Pursuing a BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science
Object-oriented programming using Java or Scala
Experience building backend systems in distributed computing environments
Algorithms and performance characteristics of large distributed software systems

Desired

Experience with real-time streaming workflow over large amounts of data
Multi-threaded programming

Want to empower digital business through real-time analytics delivered as a service? Passionate about putting the power of machine data analytics in the hands of everyone by unifying all data types, enabling universal access and leveraging cloud economics – all this from a single, unified platform delivered and consumed as a service? Come talk with us!

As a Frontend Software Engineering Intern, you will work with the engineering team to design and develop the user interface and middle tier for our enterprise machine data analytics management service. You will work with the team to define and provide a powerful yet simple and intuitive user interface that will be one of the key differentiators of the service in the marketplace. You will also work with a user experience legend as well as our talented visual designers to bring new application features to life.

What you'll do:
Build a rich user interface primarily for our mission-critical high-availability analytics platform using React and TypeScript.
Participate in user experience design with focus on ease of use, visual appeal, re-usability, and performance.
Collaborate with feature and component teams during both design and development phases to ensure adherence to UI architectural standards and best practices
Work closely with an assigned mentor

Your experience and skills should include:
Enrolled in a full time degree-seeking program with an expected graduation date in 2022.
Fluent in JavaScript/ES6/Typescript and at least one frontend framework (e.g. React, Angular, Vue)
Great passion for design and user experience
Comfortable working in an agile environment
Comfortable working with a remote team operating in multiple time zones
Comfortable communicating about your work with both technical and non-technical team members, including fellow engineers, product managers, designers, and analysts

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

At the heart of Defining Possible is our commitment to missions. In rapidly changing global security environments, Northrop Grumman brings informed insights and software-secure technology to enable strategic planning. We’re looking for innovators who can help us keep building on our wide portfolio of secure, affordable, integrated, and multi-domain systems and technologies that fuel those missions. By joining in our shared mission, we’ll support yours of expanding your personal network and developing skills, whether you are new to the field or an industry thought-leader. At Northrop Grumman, you’ll have the resources, support, and team to do some of the best work of your career.Northrop Grumman is seeking a Software Engineering Intern. This position will be located at our Mission Systems Sector in Salt Lake City, UT. The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman's software engineering team creating and maintaining unique software applications that interface with cutting edge inertial navigation and measurement systems used in military and civilian applications from undersea to outer space.Essential Functions: The There will be opportunities for designing and supporting exciting new software solutions to help modernize our product line. The primary software products are object-oriented C# designs developed using Microsoft Visual Studio, while supporting older programs in C++. Other software products provide a wide variety of opportunities with technologies including Perl, PL/SQL, Java, shell scripting, Javascript, CSS, Python, Matlab/Simulink, Excel VBA and more. Software development tasks may include everything from GUI design to low-level engineering code.
Design and develop new software using object-oriented analysis and design.
Maintain and update existing software applications.
Collaborate with system, hardware and manufacturing engineers to provide robust and user friendly applications for end-users.
Basic Qualifications for a Manufacturing Engineer Intern: A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:
Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2022.
Be majoring in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) degree
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2022 and part-time (20 hours per week) during the fall/spring semesters.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.25/4.0 or higher
Previous internship/co-op or other work experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular)
Intern Pay Range: Bachelor’s: $20.75 to $25.75 per hourMaster’s: $30.50 to $32.25 per hourAt Northrop Grumman, our internship pay rates are standardized and take into account three main factors: the anticipated graduation date of the individual, the cost of labor of the geographic location, and whether the internship is considered technical or administrative.

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Full Job Description Bluecadet is offering a six-month, paid, developer internship with our collaborative, multidisciplinary team, for the Spring/Summer of 2022. We’re looking for a technologist excited to dive into a huge range of challenges—from websites to generative visuals to camera-responsive installations and tangible interfaces—and create great work for clients who make a difference in our world.

You’ll get your hands dirty making high- and low-tech prototypes, participating in creative brainstorms and ideation, and collaborating with our NYC and Philly-based teams on generating concepts for a wide range of digital and spatial projects.

Top things this intern would accomplish within 6 months:
Active participation and prototyping that adds value to a project in concept development
Adds contributions to production software via research and/or software development
Experimented and learned to work with at least one new technology

Primary Responsibilities

Write prototypes and experiment with new technologies for client and internal projects
Work closely with tech leads and designers to build out components and conduct research
Contribute to internal discussions and brainstorming sessions

The Right Fit

A strong balance of design and technical skills, and ability to build both high- and low-tech prototypes
Energy and enthusiasm to work in a self-directed and proactive manner
Open to technical and creative direction, and working with input from across our team
Experience with creative tools such as Figma and the Adobe Creative Suite
Prototyping experience, for ex: JavaScript(Three.js, Processing/P5.js, React/Vue), Kinect, Unity or MadMapper
Understanding of and interest in interactive and user experience design
Highly organized and able to work on multiple projects
Detail-oriented, cooperative and curious
Motion graphics and/or real-world creative or coding experience a plus

Qualifications

Strong conceptual thinking paired with creative and thoughtful making
A great attitude and a lack of ego
Recent or in-progress degree in interaction design, computer science, or visual design
Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States

Remote Working Model

Bluecadet offices in Philadelphia and New York are currently fully remote. During the course of this internship the Bluecadet offices will likely open. Local candidates may have the option to work in either office locations at that time but 100% remote work will also be an option.
Interns will be expected to work a 40-hour week, and will work with their mentors to set mutually beneficial working hours
Bluecadet mentors will on-board interns to remote working tools as needed

About Bluecadet

Bluecadet is an award-winning, internationally-recognized experience design agency focused on producing transformative digital products and environments. We work with story and experience-driven organizations and brands. Past clients include Google, MoMA, Harvard, Comcast, Princeton, The Smithsonian Institution, Doctors Without Borders, National Geographic, and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.

Our Commitment to Equity and Inclusion

Bluecadet’s staff represents a wide pool of talent, views, backgrounds, and interests across our disciplines. We believe in Equity and Inclusion as a general principle and look for ways to actively amplify our team’s diverse perspectives in service of the stories and messages we are entrusted to tell.

We also recognize that we must always strive to be better. Over the past six months, we have launched internal DEI programming with a dedicated consultant to inform our business and culture moving forward. For 2021, we plan to prioritize initiatives at all levels of our organization – reflecting on leadership actions and communication, training our managers on equity and inclusion best practices, and for the whole staff, implementing inclusive meeting structures and cross-group learning.

MotionPoint’s technology and processes solve the operational complexity and cost of website localization.

Location

Coconut Creek, Florida, United States of America

Full Job Description JOB SUMMARY: The Dallas Stars are seeking an intern to join our growing Business Intelligence department. The Business Intelligence Intern will mainly support initiatives in the Ticket Sales & Service, Sponsorship, and Marketing departments. We are looking for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit who is dependable and not afraid of a challenge. The position will have a direct hand in helping influence Dallas Stars’ ability to organize, analyze, and act on current and future data to keep the business on the cutting edge.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Support business intelligence, ticketing/pricing, marketing, and strategic projects.
Build and present data visualizations, dashboards, and presentations for use across the business.
Review / update current reporting dashboards in Tableau and the SQL queries that support them.
Automate existing processes to empower business units to conduct analyses.
Assist with organizing, cleaning, and managing leads and other data in our Microsoft Dynamics CRM.
Support the creation and analysis of fan and season ticket member surveys.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Continue to advance Stars analytical capabilities and identify new revenue-generating and/or fan-creating opportunities.
Collaborate with Sponsorship and Marketing departments to analyze the current market for the Dallas Stars.
Conduct independent research on specific business topics and emerging technological areas.
Evaluate current technological infrastructure and identify areas where technology could be enhanced, added, or replaced to create efficiencies.
Identify potential data sources to integrate into the data warehouse/data lake.
Participate in communication with software vendor(s) / third parties frequently as well as evaluate potential new vendors.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
Currently pursuing or recently finished a Bachelor or Master’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Sports Analytics, or related field
Proficient in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint)
Familiarity with data visualization, CRM, and data warehousing tools and concepts
While this position is not required to attend games, it may occasionally require working long/odd hours including weekends and holidays.
0-1 year of analytics experience (or related internships), preferably within a sports organization
Experience with data visualization (Tableau, Tableau Server, Looker, PowerBI) preferred
Experience with data warehouses, queries, and ETL tools (SSMS, SQL, Alteryx, KNIME) preferred
Experience with CRM (Microsoft Dynamics, Salesforce, KORE Software) preferred
Experience with data science and statistical software (R, Python, SAS)
Experience with Ticketmaster/Archtics

Physical Demands and Working Environment
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand, walk, sit, use hands and fingers, handle objects and office tools, reach, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, talk, and hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. The employee is exposed to an office environment, with noise levels usually moderate.

Full Job Description Toyota Racing Development (TRD) is looking for motivated, high performing students. TRD inspires the hearts and minds of racing fans by advancing automotive engineering and maximizing racetrack success. A TRD internship offers students the potential for valuable learning opportunities outside the classroom within a close, fast paced, goal oriented environment.

As an intern at TRD, you will be considered an integral part of the team and will be provided with tasks that are both technically challenging and educationally stimulating. You will:

Gain new experiences related to your major

Apply classroom learning through hands-on applications

Network with professionals in your field of interest

Test drive a career and get a better grasp of your goals and interests

Expand your technical skills

Students will be assigned to teams most related to their field of study and gain exposure to the many facets of motorsports, including:

Aerodynamics

Chassis engineering

CNC programming

Engine design and development

Engine production

Manufacturing

Simulation

Positions may be located in:
Costa Mesa, CA or Salisbury, NC

A successful candidate will:
be actively enrolled in a full-time, accredited Bachelor's or above degree program studying one
of the following disciplines:
Automotive Technology
Computer Science
Manufacturing Engineering
Mechanical Engineering
be a Junior or Senior with a cumulative 3.0 GPA or higher
be able to work a 12 week summer internship
have excellent written and verbal communication skills
have working knowledge of computer application software
be able to work independently with minimal supervision

TRD is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, ancestry, religion, military or veteran status, or any other status protected by law.
